noun.description: A hinged flap at the back of a truck that can be lowered or removed when loading or unloading the vehicle.
Denoting a style of jazz trombone playing characterized by improvisation in the manner of the early New Orleans musicians.

examples: he started tailgating the car in front
drivers who will tailgate at 90 mph

verb.description: Host or attend a social gathering at which an informal meal is served from the back of a parked vehicle, typically in the parking lot of a sports stadium.
examples: Lot 16E is reserved for alumni who wish to tailgate before the game
